unit_learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate a refined awareness of language and language use, in both German and in English.
Apply relevant language conventions to create meaningful intercultural encounters.
Develop comprehensive intermediate level skills in reading, writing, listening and speaking in the German language.
Identify, describe and evaluate a broad range of aspects of German-speaking cultures and societies.
Identify, evaluate and deploy a broad range of grammatical structures of German at an intermediate level.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: On-campus and external students revise the weekly content through the use of various self-study resources, practice and apply newly acquired structures and vocabulary, and engage with the relevant material provided on iLearn.

assessments.description: Students complete various short test of mixed question types. These tests are scheduled during class time.
Each student researches and presents a pre-approved, content related topic in the target language. On-campus students will present in class, external students present in a live virtual format
Students engage with a variety of low stakes tasks focussing on language production.
Students complete a variety of mixed-type questions, including one essay-style question. The exam covers the content of the entire unit.
assessments.offerings: Session 2-exam_att-Exam centre within Australia , Session 2-Weekday-North Ryde

assessments.description: Students complete a variety of mixed-type questions, including one essay-style question. The exam covers the content of the entire unit. Student will complete their final test online.
Each student researches and presents a pre-approved, content related topic in the target language. On-campus students will present in class, external students present in a live virtual format
assessments.offerings: Session 2-exam_att-Exam centre within Australia , Session 2-Weekday-North Ryde

assessments.description: On-campus and external students demonstrate active engagement with the weekly content through participating in the designated activities online and, where applicable, in class.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Attendance for exam only, Exam centre within Australia
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: Through this unit students are able to become independent users of German. It provides activities for developing German reading, comprehension, writing and speaking skills. The work in this unit is of a very intensive nature. This unit corresponds to the fourth level (B2) on the six-level scale of competence laid down in the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR).
data.title: I German Studies 4
